title: Decolonization
summary: Decolonization (American and Oxford English) or decolonisation (other British English) is the undoing of colonialism, the latter being the process whereby a nation establishes and maintains its domination of foreign territories, often overseas territories.[1] The concept particularly applies to the dismantlement, during the second half of the 20th century, of the colonial empires established prior to World War I throughout the world.[2] Some scholars of decolonization focus especially on the movements in the colonies demanding independence, such as Creole nationalism.[3]
